absolutely fits so rather than settle for close enough this will let you get a custom fit first figure out your row gauge lay the sock out flat and measure on the back of your sock measure how many row there are in an inch to get your row gauge row gauge ________ next figure out how long your sock needs to be this measurement should be your foot length minus 1/2 for negative ease here is a link to shoe size charts if the foot you are knitting for is not your own http //www zappos com/c/shoe-size-conversion sock length ________ the gusset and heel take 35 47 53 row on a 48 64 72 stitch sock divide 35 47 53 by your row gauge to get the number of inches needed for your gusset gusset length ________ subtract your gusset length from your sock length to get the number of inches you need to knit before you start your gusset before gusset length ______ example plugging in my dimensions my shoe size is a women s 11 5 that means that my sock length should be 10 17 inches long after subtracting 1/2 for negative ease with a row gauge of 12 row per inch my gusset length is 3 84 my before gusset length measurement is 6 34 row gauge matters for 11 row per inch the length i need to knit before beginning the gusset changes to 5 99 it s critical to measure an accurate row gauge footnote pun intended my left foot is 1/8 inch longer than my right foot do i make my left sock 1/8 longer yes because they are my socks and i want to so there gusset row 1 knit across front in pattern on back of sock k1 m1r knit until one stitch from end m1l k1 row 2 knit in pattern repeat these two row until you have 73 97 109 stitches per sock 25 33 37 on the front and 48 64 72 on the back heel flap knit across front stitches in pattern on the back of the sock k 12 16 18 using waste yarn knit 24 32 36 turn and purl back 24 32 36 with your sock yarn knit to end of round and across front in pattern you are now in position to knit the heel flap row 1 knit until 13 17 19 stitches from end ssk and turn work row 2 slip first stitch purl until 13 17 19 stitches from end p2tog turn work you will now have a gap on either side of your heel flap stitches and can easily see where to decrease
